tr.td: Name
Description
Nice value set on the process. If nice is not set, the value will be null (higher numbers are lower priority).
Group of user who owns the process
Number of threads the process owns.
Current working directory of the process.
User who owns the process
Total resident memory of the process (in bytes).
Process ID.
Total number of faults.
Total number of major page faults. Major faults generally involve disk latency.
Total number of minor page faults. Minor faults generally do not involve disk latency.
Total resident memory that is shared with other processes (in bytes).
Path to the executable.
Root namespace of the process.
Total address space of the process (in bytes).
Name of the executable.
Parent process ID.
Priority of the process (higher numbers are lower priority).
CPU ID of the processor running the process (to be deleted).
(to be deleted)
Start time of the process (Epoch timestamp in milliseconds).
Total time executing system calls (in milliseconds).
Total time executing (in milliseconds).
Total time executing in user mode (in milliseconds).
